text: e Welcome to my 2021 Metrics and Facts sheet for Overtime accounts across all platforms, if you have any questions leave a comment - Maxalan

Crowdtangle 142 2021-01-10 00:00:00 OTea Snapchat Viewership With 9.35MM unique viewers in December, OTea has already earned more uniques in a single month than any Overtime snap account in the 2021 145 2021-01-10 00:00:00 Overtime Now Snapchat Viewership Over 14MM people watched an episode of Overtime Now in 2021, most unique viewers of any OT Snap channel - Snap Analytics 146 2021-01-10 00:00:00 Overtime Now Snapchat Time Spent With 167 million minutes watched in 2021, Overtime Now produced the 5th most minutes watched of all OT accounts across all platforms, behind OT TikTok, OT IG, OT Youtube, and SZN Youtube 151 2021-01-10 00:00:00 International Instagram Viewership Together, Overtime Europe and France accumulated over 14MM views and 1.3MM engagements in their coverage of the 2021 FIBA U-19 tournament - text: CROSS-PLATFORM 2023 POWER STATS OVERTIME LEAGUE POWER STATS Viewership Overtime accounts reached 32BN total views in 2023, boiling down to over 60,000 views per minute and 1,000 views per second across the entire year. The growth of Overtime's leagues was the primary focus for 2023 and it showed in content performance. Overtime's league accounts showed at least 200% year over year increases in views (5BN), time spent (1BN minutes), and followers added (8MM) Time Spent For the second consecutive year, fans spent a collective 7BN minutes consuming Overtime content Overtime's league accounts tripled in total followers in 2023, going from 4MM to over 12MM followers in just 12 months - Platform API's Engagement OT Fans engaged with Overtime content 35% more times in 2023, reaching 2.7BN for the year. Overtime's leagues (OT7, OTX, and OTE) made up 3 of the top 4 growth verticals and 3 of the top 6 verticals in cross-platform views for the year 2023 Follower Growth Overtime accounts brought in 21MM new followers in 2023, the most in a single year since 2019. Today, Overtime accounts hold over 97.5MM followers. OTX launched in 2023 and brought a wave of viewership and growth. OTX produced the 3rd most views and 2nd most new followers of all Overtime accounts. \n TikTok Overtime’s TikTok accounts hold a collective 50MM followers and occupy 5 of the top 25 spots on the US Sports Media leaderboard - Tubular Instagram Instagram was the greatest source of growth in 2023, with Overtime accounts adding 8MM new followers and surpassing 20MM followers across all accounts combined - Platform API's

Overtime Main 🏀 OTE 🏀 Overtime SZN 🏈 Platform KEY INSIGHTS Platform KEY INSIGHTS Platform KEY INSIGHTS All Platforms Overtime's Main account laid the foundation for a successful 2023 with 18BN views (+14% YoY) and 7.7MM new followers (+21% YoY) Cross-Platform OTE Performance To Date: OTE fans have spent over 1.6B minutes watching OTE content and have amassed 5B views on OTE content since the league's inception. Cross-Platform SZN produced over 2BN views for the 2nd consecutive year and remains Overtime's 2nd largest vertical, surpassing 6MM followers in 2023 All Platforms 15.6BN views across Instagram and TikTok, more than NBA, NFL, MLB, NHL, Nike, Adidas, and Bleacher Report - Tubular, \nNote: Reels views are estimated based on engagements Cross-Platform Growth 2023 League Growth: With a combined 7.7MM followers** between OTE league and team accounts, the OTE vertical added 400,000 new followers per month and grew over 150% in 2023. Instagram In 2023, SZN added more new Instagram followers (470K) than all but 3 NFL teams: Taylor Swift’s Chiefs and the two teams who met in the 2023 NFC championship, Eagles and 49ers - Crowdtangle Instagram One of only 4 US Sports Media accounts with 1BN engagements in 2023. The ONLY account that doesn't own media rights to major sports league with 1BN engagements - Conviva Cross-Platform Teams From Sept - December 2023, OTE teams had produced over 400MM views and added 1MM new followers Instagram On Instagram, Overtime SZN finished 2023 in the top 5% for all US Sports Media accounts for total engagements (168MM) and engagements per post (56K) - Conviva Instagram Added more Instagram followers (3.1M) in 2023 than ESPN, Bleacher Report, NIke, Adidas, NHL, MLB and the NFL - Crowdtangle Instagram With 71% growth in 2023, OTE is one of the fastest growing sports leagues in the world - Conviva YouTube 28% more engaging than the average YouTube channel from US Sports Media publishers in 2023 (3,700 engagements per video vs. 2,900) - Conviva, shorts included TikTok Among all US Sports Media accounts on TikTok, Overtime finished 2023 tied for 1st with 2.4MM views per video - Tubular TikTok TikTok vs. Major Leagues: OTE’s TikTok channel outperformed the NBA, MLB, and NHL in all performance metrics: including views per video, engagements per video, and engagement rate - Tubular, 2023 TikTok SZN's 3.7MM TikTok followers makes it the largest football account among US Sports Media brands, reaching more football fans than 31 out of 32 NFL teams on TikTok -- Tubular, Relo Metrics TikTok Generated over 7.5BN TikTok views in 2023, 64% increase year over year and the most views in OT history for single account on one platform TikTok OTE Teams vs. Major League Teams: On TikTok, OTE teams (Cold Hearts, City Reapers, RWE, and YNG Dreamerz) were 4 of the top 15 most viewed teams in the United States. This includes all teams from the NFL, NBA, MLB, NHL, and MLS - Tubular, 2023 TikTok SZN’s 647MM views and 70MM engagements on 2023 TikTok posts was more than every NFL team - Tubular Twitter Averaged 2,800 engagements per video in 2023, 2.5x more than the average US Sports Media account on Twitter - Conviva YouTube YouTube vs. Major Leagues: With over 11,000 engagements per video in 2023, OTE's YouTube channel was 3x more engaging than every major US Sports League on YouTube (NFL, NBA, MLB, and NHL) - Tubular, 2023 YouTube Became the fastest US Sports Media channel to reach 3MM subscribers without media rights to a major professional league - Tubular, YouTube YouTube OTE fans spent over 200MM minutes watching OTE content on TV screens in 2023, a 5x increase from 41MM minutes in 2022 - YouTube Studio YouTube 66% more engaging than the average YouTube channel from US Sports Media publishers in 2023 (4,800 engagements per video vs. 2,900) - Conviva, shorts included **please use updated following in OTE Tab

text: OTX 🥊 Overtime FC ⚽️ OT7 🏈 Platform KEY INSIGHTS Platform KEY INSIGHTS Platform KEY INSIGHTS Cross-Platform From June-December 2023, OTX channels have accumulated over 1.7BN views on boxing content and quadrupled in audience size, encompassing 2.3MM followers across all platforms Cross-Platform Overtime FC was 1 of 5 Overtime accounts to reach 1BN views in 2023, representing a 27% increase in year over year viewership Cross-Platform OT7 accounts generated 767MM views in 2023, a 152% year over year increase compared to 2022 Cross-Platform Across Instagram and TikTok, OTX produced more combined views (1.7BN), more engagements (140MM), and added more followers in 2023 than older boxing brands like ESPN Ringside, Matchroom, Top Rank, WBC, GoldenBoy, and MVP -- Tubular, Conviva Cross-Platform In 2023, Overtime FC is Overtime's 3rd largest vertical, surpassing 5MM combined followers across all platforms Cross-Platform Growth OT7 accounts crossed 2MM followers in 2023, a 202% year over year increase Instagram OTX added over 772K Instagram followers since June 1st, more new followers than every competitor: including Top Rank, ESPN Ringside, WBC, and Matchroom added in all of 2023 — CrowdTangle, 2023 Instagram Out of 89 US Sports Media accounts with over 350K followers, Overtime FC and OTX were the only two accounts to double in size in a single year - Conviva Cross-Platform OT7 is the true shining star of emerging football leagues on social. Across Instagram and TikTok in 2023, OT7 earned 11x more views and 5x more engagements than the XFL and USFL combined - Crowdtangle, Tubular Instagram Out of 89 US Sports Media accounts with over 350K followers, Overtime FC and OTX were the only two accounts to double in size in a single year - Conviva Instagram Behind a gaudy average of 154K engagements per video on Instagram, Overtime FC finished 2023 as the most engaging soccer account and 7th most engaging account overall in US Sports Media - Conviva Instagram Top 1% for Instagram Growth: With a staggering growth rate of 105% in 2023, OT7's Instagram growth ranks in the top 1% for all US Sports Media accounts - Conviva TikTok OTX launched six months into 2023 and still became 1 of only 10 US Sports Media accounts to produce over 1BN TikTok views in 2023 – Tubular TikTok FC ranks in the top 25 for US Sports Media accounts and is one of the largest soccer media accounts with 3.6MM TikTok followers - TikTok Analytics, Tubular TikTok The average TikTok post on OT7 earned 3x more views per video than the average post for NFL teams on TikTok (332K vs. 110K) - Tubular, 2023 TikTok On TikTok, OTX led all boxing accounts in total views, views per video, and engagements per video in 2023 - Tubular TikTok FC has logged at least 150MM TikTok views for 5 consecutive years - TikTok Analytics YouTube Recaps At 140K views per video, OT7's 2023 YouTube Recaps were 4x higher than the US Sports Media baseline for YouTube viewership - Tubular Quick link to OTX Tab for more stats and insights YouTube Broadcasts YouTube Reach & Retention: YouTube broadcasts (Live + VOD) from OT7 championship weekend are averaging over 2MM impressions, with the typical viewing session lasting 65 minutes on TV screens and 49 minutes across all devices combined - YouTube Analytics

text: Note: As of Q1 2022, Youtube demo comparisons are based on views, instead of engagements
Updated as of: August 2022
Next update: July 2023
How does Overtime's YouTube audience compare to our competitors?
KEY TAKEAWAYS
- The Gen-Z Sports fan is 83% more likely to watch Youtube content on Overtime than Youtube content from one of Overtime's major competitors
- With an index of 292 vs. the competitive average, teens on Youtube is 3x more likely to watch Overtime content than a major competitor of Overtime
- Female viewers are 35% more likely to watch Overtime's Youtube content than that of a major competitor
- Compared to ESPN, Overtime's Youtube content is 329% more likely to appeal to teen viewers, 114% more likely to appeal to Gen-Z viewers, and 71% more likely to appeal to female viewers
What's changed since last update? -- As our competitor's audience ages upward, Overtime's lead in reaching Gen-Z and Millennials increases:
- A1317 decreased significantly for some of our competitors — increasing the OT teen index vs competitors average from 222 to 292
- A1324 index increased from 159 to 183
- A1334 index increased from 113 to 119
- A1834 index increased from 105 to 109
- Female index increased from 104 to 135

January 2022 HEADLINES 🗞
     
 Overall Stats: 2.4B Views | 754MM Minutes | 160MM Engagements | 70MM Followers


1. After setting another company views record with 2.4B in January, Overtime's monthly average viewership now sits at 2.1B views per month, a 31% year over year increase - Platform API's

2. Quality and Quantity: Along with a new viewership average of 2.1B views per month, OT fans are consuming 46% more minutes of OT content compared to last year's rolling average (648MM vs. 442MM)  - Platform API's

3. On Youtube, OT fans tripled their total consumption of Overtime content to a record 289MM minutes watched, behind a record watch time of 30 minutes per viewing session on OT Youtube - Youtube Analytics

4. With OT's "Family Business" debut performing 8x better than industry average, the Ellis Brothers are prime to become Overtime's next viral superstars. - Youtube Analytics

5. Facebook viewership spikes from Asian countries helped drive 395MM views in January, a 72% MoM increase and 2nd most of all time - Facebook Analytics

6. Through consistent coverage of NFL playoffs and CFB bowl season, SZN channels produced a record 233MM views in January - Platform API's

7. Despite only being a one-day event this year, Overtime Takeover 2.0 content produced 20MM views and 5MM engagements - Platform API's

8. OT's TikTok channels now combine for over 30MM followers and continue to expand with new international channels and talent-led pods adding 150K new followers in January  - Platform API's

October 2021 HEADLINES 🗞
     
 Overall Stats: 1.4B Views | 445MM Minutes | 112MM Engagements | 65M Followers

1) 20% Increase in Minutes Watched YoY: Through October 2021, Overtime fans have watched a combined 4.6 BILLION minutes of Overtime content, a 20% increase YoY versus the first 10 months of 2020 - Platform API's

2) 55MM Social Followers, 10MM Talent Followers: Two major milestones in one month! Overtime's social following eclipsed 55MM followers while Overtime's Talent have separately accrued a combined 10MM followers, separately - Platform API's

3) 100MM+ Engagements: For the seventh consecutive month, OT accounts combined for over 100MM engagements across all platforms - Platform API's
 
4) New Slate of Youtube Shows: Overtime and SZN released five (5) new shows in October that averaged 30% more views and 80% more engagements than the 2021 US Sports Media average - Tubular

5) 14% Increase in IG Reach: With 87MM Instagram accounts reached in October, Overtime's 3-month rolling average for reach increased by 14% from 74MM accounts to 84MM accounts - Instagram Analytics

6) OTE Opening Weekend: OTE opening weekend was a massive success wiith OTE content accruing 23MM views and 8.7 million engagements in the span of 72 hours

7) OTE vs. World Series: With 3.72MM Instagram views and 6MM TikTok views, OTE outperformed the Braves and Astros IG accounts and the MLB's TikTok account during the same timespan that featured Games 3, 4, and 5 of the World Series - Crowdtangle, TikTok Analytics

8) 43% Growth on OTE Channels: In 31 days, OTE channels gained 234,000 followers, a 43% increase MoM. By the time a person watches an hour of an HBO show, OTE channels had gained 315 followers - Platform API's 

9) What's the OTea?: OTea, Overtime's newest Snap show following the latest celebrity gossip, gained 20K subs in its first month, 2nd largest month of growth by any OT snap channel in 2021 - Snap Analytics

September 2021 HEADLINES 🗞
     
 Overall Stats: 1.4B views | 480MM Minutes | 103MM Engagements | 54.4M Followers

1) 480MM Minutes Watched: 13th consecutive month with over 400MM+ minutes watched and a 16% increase in monthly minutes watched from Q2 to Q3 (422MM vs. 493MM)

2) Doubled Youtube Minutes from Q2 to Q3: After averaging 94MM Youtube minutes watched per month in Q2 2021, OT accounts doubled that with a Q3 average of 194MM minutes watched per month - Youtube Studio

3) 100MM+ Engagements: For the sixth consecutive month, OT accounts combined for over 100MM engagements across all platforms - Platform API's
 
4) 44% More Monthly IG Views: OT accounts averaged a combined 820MM Instagram views in Q3 2021, a 44% increase from 570MM views per month in Q2 2021
- Crowdtangle, Instagram Analytics

5) Reaching 60% More IG Accts: From Q2 to Q3 2021, Overtime Main's monthly Instagram reach saw a 60% increase from 46MM accounts in Q2 to 74MM accounts in Q3 - Instagram Analytics

6) September Belongs to SZN: In September, SZN set a channel record with 132MM minutes watched, reached 500K Youtube subs, and surpassed 1MM Instagram followers - Youtube Studio, Crowdtangle

7) OT Films: Overtime's newest long-form format on Youtube crushed in September. On average, Parts 1 and 2 of the Justin Fields doc were viewed 4x more often (192K vs. 52K) and earned 4x more engagements (4.5K vs. 1.1K) than the 2021 US Sports Media average - Tubular

8) OTE Blasts on the Scene: In the first week of existence, OTE's new Instagram channel added more followers in a single week (40K) than any Men's CBB channel has added in all of 2021. On TikTok, NXT was converted to OTE, quadrupling the channel's following from 50K to 200K followers - Youtube Studio, TikTok Analytics

9) OT Main Climbing the IG Ranks: According to Conviva, if Overtime were a pro sports team, we would rank as the 6th largest Instagram account amongst 148 US pro sports teams, the 5 accounts ahead of us are all NBA teams - Conviva Leaderboards

August 2021 HEADLINES 🗞
     
 Overall Stats: 1.60B Views | 533MM Minutes | 114MM Engagements | 53.5MM Followers

1) 533MM+ Minutes: Second most minutes in a single month in OT history, only behind the 610MM in March 2021

2) 200MM Minutes on Youtube: Record 207MM minutes watched, beating out our previous record of 195MM minutes set in March - Youtube Studio

3) 900MM IG Views -- Record-breaking month for OT accounts combining for 900MM Instagram views.  -- Crowdtangle/IG Anayltics
 
4) Instagram Stories: Overtime earned a record 263MM IG Story views in August, averaging a colossal 637K views per story post, more than double OT's benchmark average of 300K -- Instagram Analytics

5) Reached 80MM IG Accts: Sparked by the reach of Reels, Overtime content reached 80MM Instagram accounts in August, 29% more than any other month in OT history - IG Analytics

6) Million View Marathons: Fear Nothing S2+S3 Marathon earned 1MM views in August with an average watch time of 47 minutes per viewing session. Of the 26 episodic marathons released on OT and SZN combined, half reached 1MM views and five reached 3MM views - Tubular

7) Snap Retention: Snap identifies successful shows as those with an average watch time above 1:30. Overtime had four shows surpass the 1:30 threshold in August (Newmans, Fear Nothing, To The House, and Superteam) -- Snap Analytics

July 2021 HEADLINES 🗞
 
 Overall Stats: 1.59B Views | 465MM Minutes | 121MM Engagements | 52.8MM Followers

1) 465MM+ Minutes: With 465MM minutes watched in July, OT's string of consecutive months of 400M+ minutes reaches 11 months - Platform API's

2) 1MM Followers Per Month: With 53MM total followers combined, Overtime's social accounts have added 1MM+ new followers, every month for 24 of the last 25 months - Platform API's

3) 4x Record for IG Views -- A robust combination of IGTV, reels, story, and carousel posts led to 743MM views in July, the 4th consecutive month of record IG views across all OT channels combined -- Instagram Analytics

4) Reels, Reels, Reels: Produced 349MM views in July, 83% more views than In-Feed Instagram posts (video, carousel, IGTV) on 58% fewer posts -- Instagram Analytics

5) Fans "Like Like" OT on IGTV: Instagram viewers are twice as likely to engage with an IGTV post from Overtime (20%) than an IGTV post from the average US Sports Media publisher (9.4%) -- Crowdtangle, H1 2021

6) Four Shows, Triple the Views : OT and SZN had four active Youtube shows in July that averaged over 160K views per episode, outperforming the industry by 3.5x – Newmans, TTH, Day in the Life, and Subject 2 Change -- Tubular

7) OT Runs Marathons: With average watch times of 36 minutes and 31 minutes respectively, Fear Nothing S2+S3 and Chopping Wood became the 13th and 14th OT marathon to keep viewers glued to their seats for over 30 minutes -- Youtube Analytics

8) Two Benjamins on Facebook: Back-to-back months with 200MM+ views for only the 2nd time in company history (Oct-Nov 2020) -- Facebook Analytics 2020 Best of the Best Headlines 🗞
 
2020 Stats: 18.5B Views | 4.8B Minutes Watched | 46MM Followers

1) YoY Increases In 2020: Compared to 2019, Overtime accounts earned 76% more views, 69% more minutes watched, and doubled its fanbase. 

2) Most Engaging Sports Brand: Overtime finished 2020 with the highest engagement rate amongst all competitors on Instagram, YouTube, Twitter, and Facebook (Tubular, 2020)

2) 3rd in IGTV Viewership: Overtime earned 317MM IGTV views in 2020, ranked 3rd amongst major sports channels and outpacing larger competitors such as Bleacher Report -- Crowdtangle, 2020

3) Fastest Growing Accounts on IG: Overtime owns 4 of the top 15 fastest growing Instagram channels in all of US Sports Media (OT = 2nd, SZN = 6th, FC = 11th, WBB = 15th) - Crowdtangle, 2020

4) #1 in YouTube Views Per Video: For the 2nd consecutive year, Overtime YouTube content earned more views per video (235K) than all major competitors (ESPN, BR, HoH, Barstool, Uninterrupted, Players's Tribune)

5) 4th Largest YouTube Channel: In only 4 years, Overtime has acquired 2MM YouTube subscribers, becoming the 4th largest YouTube channel in US Sports Media, behind NBA rights-holders: ESPN, HoH, and BR (Conviva, 2020)

6) YouTube Marathons: Overtime YouTube accounts dominated the competition with 5 of the top 10 marathon-length videos (60+ min. in duration) from US Sports Media publishers

7) CTV Viewership: Overtime fans spent 660MM minutes watching Overtime YouTube content via CTV devices in 2020, staying for an average of 14 minutes per viewing session. 

8) 1B Views on Facebook: Overtime was 1 of 7 accounts to reach 1B total Facebook views in 2020 with the highest engagement rate than all major competitors such as Sportscenter, ESPN, Bleacher Report, Barstool, etc. - Tubular, 2020

9) 3rd Largest Snapchat Publisher: Overtime grew 78% YoY on Snapchat to become the 3rd largest sports publisher on Snapchat with 10MM subs across all channels

10) Leading Sports Brand on Tik-Tok: On Tiktok, OT social accounts now combine for over 22MM followers, including the #1 sports account, #1 football account, #1 women's sports account, and the #1 soccer account in the US Sports Media landscape - TikTok API

text:
June 2021 HEADLINES 🗞
     
 Overall Stats: 1.54B Views | 412MM Minutes | 112MM Engagements | 51.9MM Followers

1) 400MM+ Minutes: For the 10th consecutive month, Overtime fans consumed 400MM+ minutes of Overtime content  - Platform API's

2) 1MM Followers Per Month: With 52MM total followers combined, Overtime's social accounts have added over 1MM followers in 23 of the last 24 months - Platform API's

3) 62MM IG Accounts Reached: 62MM Instagram accounts saw content from Overtime's Instagram in June, a new record for a single month and a 50% increase from May - Instagram Analytics

4) Facebook Up Big YoY: OT Facebook has already accumulated 37% more views in 2021 than the entire year of 2020 (1.44B vs. 1.05B)  - Facebook Analytics

5) NFL Draft House: Overtime SZN's hottest show averaged 3x more views than the US Sports Media average (124K vs. 42K) and the highest average watch time (7:00) of all OT shows in May and June - Conviva, Tubular

6) 5 of the Top 25 on TikTok: With the surge of Overtime Kicks to 1.3MM followers, Overtime accounts now combine for over 26MM TikTok followers. More impressively, 5 OT accounts rank in the Top 25 for Sports Media accounts   - Conviva

April 2021 HEADLINES 🗞
     
 Overall Stats: 1.62B Views | 444MM Minutes Watched |105MM Engagements | 49.3MM Followers

1) 8 Months over 400MM Minutes: For the 8th consecutive month, Overtime fans consumed 400MM+ minutes of Overtime content - Platform API's

2) 50MM Follower Watch: At the current growth rate, Overtime is poised to eclipse 50MM combined followers across all OT social accounts in May 2021 - Platform API's

3) 100MM YouTube Minutes for the 7th time in the last 8 months, equivalent to UCLA's undergrad population of 32,000 students binging all 23 movies of the Marvel series -- YouTube Studio

4) 500MM+ Instagram Views: In back to back months, OT accounts combined for over 500MM Instagram views, for the first time in company history - Crowdtangle

5) Back to Back on Twitter: Back to back months with 40MM+ views on Overtime Twitter, twice Overtime's monthly average dating back to February 2020 - Twitter Analytics 

6) Kicks Still Blazin': Kicks continues to be the hottest Overtime account earning 66MM TikTok views and adding 192K new TikTok followers in April - TikTok Analytics

March 2021 HEADLINES 🗞
     
 Overall Stats: 1.80B Views | 611MM Minutes Watched | 48MM Followers

1) Records on Records: For the first time in company history, Overtime eclipsed 1.8B views and 600MM minutes, beating out previous records for both categories by 3% and 20% respectively.

2) Facebook Momentum: Overtime beat out it's previous Facebook record by 60% in March with 431MM views. Over the last 2 quarters, OT is averaging 250MM Facebook views per month, a 5x increase from the 6 months prior - Tubular

3) Instagram up 70%: Over the last two quarters, the combined monthly average Instagram views on Overtime accounts are up 71% compared to our combined total from Q2 and Q3 2020 (473MM vs. 273MM) - Crowdtangle / Instagram Metrics

4) Newmans & Fear Nothing: Overtime's episodic 2-headed monster dominated March averaging 753K views per episode, 4.3x more views than our competitor's average in March (157K) - Tubular, March 2021

5) Twitter Explosion: Overtime earned an incredible 41 million views on Twitter this month, a 77% increase MoM and most since November 2019 - Twitter Analytics 

6) Overtime Kicks: Debuting on OT Kicks Snap channel, Paint Wars reeled in 1MM unique viewers in March. On TikTok, OT Kicks added 118K followers this month, 2nd most of all OT accounts on all platforms  - Snap Analytics, TikTok Analytics

FEBRUARY 2021 STATS 📊
     
 Overall Stats: 1.41B Views | 400MM Minutes Watched | 46.7MM Followers

FEBRUARY 2021 HEADLINES 🗞

1) 400MM Minutes: Overtime fans watched 400MM minutes of OT content in a month that only contains 40,320 minutes total. With every passing minute, fans viewed 10,000 minutes of OT content, equivalent to a week's worth of time.

2) Facebook Viewership: Overtime set a new channel record with 266MM Facebook views in February, outperforming all major competitors including Sportscenter, ESPN, Bleacher Report, and Barstool for the 2nd consecutive month - Tubular

3) Gambling on SZN: Overtime SZN new gambling series, Four Quarters of Fortune, earned 100K views per episode on YouTube, 2x more views than the industry average - Tubular

4) Return of Fear Nothing: Overtime's biggest YouTube show from 2020 returned to the tune of 800K views per episode in February, 17x more than industry average - Tubular

5) Different on Snap: With unique stories of athletes overcoming improbable odds, OT's newest Snap show, Different, averaged 1.4MM viewers per week in February - Snap Analytics

6) TikTok Milestones: On TikTok, Overtime became the first sports account to reach 15MM followers while Overtime SZN became the first football media account to reach 2MM followers

JANUARY 2021 STATS 📊
     
 Overall Stats: 1.65B Views | 405MM Minutes Watched | 46MM Followers

JANUARY 2021 HEADLINES 🗞

1) 1.65B VIews: 3rd highest month in OT history and 11th consecutive month with at least 1.5B views

2) 400MM+ Minutes: Overtime fans watched at least 400 million minutes of Overtime content for the 5th consecutive month

3) 1MM Per Month: As a collective, Overtime accounts have gained over 1MM followers per month, every month since July 2019.

4) Facebook Viewership: Overtime's 189MM Facebook views in January ranked higher than all major competitors including Sportscenter, ESPN, Bleacher Report, and Barstool - Tubular

5) Big Month on SZN: Channel record 27MM Instagram views and the return of Primetime 2.0 averaged 290K YouTube views per episode, 5.5x the industry average in January  - Tubular

6) Power of WBB: In honoring Kobe and GiGi Bryant, Kobe's wife Vanessa reshared WBB's Tribute on her Instagram feed. Her only post where she allowed comments.

7) 1B Likes on TIkTok: Out of 800 million TikTok accounts, Overtime became 1 of 47 to reach 1B likes making it a top 50 account on the app - Social Ranker

OCTOBER 2020 STATS 📊
    
   1.74B Views | 474MM Minutes Watched | 95MM Engagements | 43MM Followers

OCTOBER 2020 HEADLINES 🗞
     
1) Record-Setting Month: In October 2020, Overtime set a new company record with 474MM minutes watched across all accounts and platforms, equivalent to watching the entire Harry Potter series over 400,000 times.

2) U.S. Teens Prefer OT: According to Tubular's October data release, Overtime reached more American teens on YouTube (285,802) than major competitors such as: ESPN, Bleacher Report, House of Highlights, and Barstool in September -- Tubular

3) OT's Hit Shows, Hit Different: When compared to our competitive set, OT's current slate of YouTube shows produce 163% more first week views and nearly double the engagement rate (Comp set includes ESPN, BR, HoH, Barstool, Uninterrupted, and TPT) -- Tubular, Sep-Oct 2020

4) OT Thrives on Facebook, Too: A new Facebook strategy on Overtime led to a company-record 225MM FB views in October, beating out industry giants such as ESPN, Bleacher Report, and Barstool -- Tubular

5) Interactive Instagram Stories: Through interactive IG stories, Overtime set a new company-record 532MM Instagram views this month, along with a 55% increase in Instagram Reach to 14MM accounts per week-- Instagram Analytics

6) Leading Sports Brand on Tik-Tok: On Tiktok, OT social accounts now combine for over 20MM followers, representing a 4x increase year over year. Additionally, OT owns the #1 sports account, #1 football account, #1 women's sports account, and the #1 soccer account in the US Sports Media landscape - TikTok API

SEPTEMBER 2020 HEADLINES 🗞
     
1) Record-Setting Month: In October 2020, Overtime earned more overall views and more minutes watched than any month 

2) Time Spent with OT: Over the last 6 months, YouTube users have spent over 10.5 minutes per viewing session watching OT content, +48% higher than ESPN, Bleacher Report, and House of Highlights -- Tubular Reports

3) OT's Hit Shows, Hit Different: When compared to the YouTube averages for our competitive set, OT's current slate of shows produce 163% more first week views and nearly double the engagement rate (Comp set includes ESPN, BR, HoH, Barstool, Uninterrupted, and TPT) -- Tubular, Sep-Oct 2020

4) New Facebook Strategy: In 2020, US Sports Media publishers have posted 3,400 videos that are 60+ min. in duration. Among these 3,400 videos, Overtime marathons take the top two spots and 3 of the top 10 overall (Newmans S2 (#1), Primetime (#2), Bunchie #3) -- Tubular

5) IG Stories: Overtime's IGTV videos have outperformed the average US Sports Media account by at least 200%, every month, for the past six (6) months -- Tubular

6) Leading Sports Brand on Tik-Tok: OT social accounts now combine for over 20MM followers on TikTok, representing a 4x increase YoY! Additionally, OT owns the #1 sports account, #1 football account, #1 women's sports account, and the #1 soccer account in the US Sports Media landscape - TikTok API
OT Benchmark Averages By Platform, Account, and Post Type

YOUTUBE BENCHMARK INSIGHTS Can we implement the following metrics? - Compared to US Sports Media publishers with over 1MM followers, Overtime averages 4.8x more engagements per post on YouTube and 2.6x more engagements per post on Instagram Competitive CTR - On YouTube, sponsored content is nearly twice as engaging on Overtime YouTube channels than the average US Sports Media publisher Quartile Views - Overtime's YouTube content averages 3.2x more organic views per video than the average US Sports Media publisher with at lesat 1MM subscribers View Rate

Episodic Performance Grid: a reference to compare Overtime shows to each other and vs. industry averages
TOP SHOW POWER STATS
- OT produced 20 shows that averaged more views per video than the US Sports Media average (70K) in 2020
- OT has four (5) Snapchat shows that have each accumulated 20MM+ unique viewers since April 2019 -- Bunchie, Newmans, OT Now, Hype School, and Fear Nothing
- Of the 24 episodic marathons released on OT and SZN combined, 12 have surpassed 1MM views and 5 have surpassed 3MM views
- OT episodic marathons averaged 901K views per episode in 2020, an average that was 300K higher than any other US Sports Media publisher

- Twelve (12) different OT marathons averaged over 30 minutes per viewing session: Newmans S2, Primetime (S1, S3, & Games), Fear Nothing (S1, S2+S3), Prolific (Pt. 1 & Pt. 2), To The House, Bunchie, Dual Threat, Kardell Thomas
- Prolific Prep currently holds the OT record for time spent per viewing session (9:00) and engagement rate (4.6%)
